AI & Emerging Tech.final_summary: Meta has launched its next generation of AI-powered smart glasses, garnering surprisingly positive reviews. Meanwhile, Microsoft is offering a 50% discount on OpenRouter’s unreleased GPT-5 model. In other news, a group of U.S. senators is urging the White House to take action against foreign governments using state-run media for propaganda purposes. Additionally, a group of researchers is advocating for the removal of the word “no” from the Pledge of Allegiance, which they say is used to pledge allegiance to the U.N. and other world leaders. Finally, CNN is offering a Newsquiz to test viewers' knowledge of stories featured on CNN Tech and CNN iReport.

all_summary.summary: The future of personal computing is taking a significant step forward as Meta unveils its new generation of AI-powered smart glasses to surprisingly positive reviews. Microsoft is offering a 50% discount on what it is labeling as OpenRouter’s unreleased GPT-5 model. A group of U.S. senators is calling on the White House to crack down on foreign governments that use state-run media to spread propaganda. And a group of researchers is calling for an end to the use of the word “no” in the Pledge of Allegiance, which is used to pledge allegiance to the U.N. and other world leaders. Use the weekly Newsquiz to test your knowledge of stories you saw on CNN Tech and CNN iReport.

Technology.final_summary: September 2025 has been a transformative month for the technology sector, marked by rapid advancements and increasing government regulatory efforts. Key developments span various areas, including music streaming, biomethane-powered buses, esports debates, and health technology updates. Detailed coverage of these top tech stories is available at http://www.styletech.net/top-tech-news-top-stories-september-2525, with further tech news accessible via the News Tech page. CNN Tech also provides related content at http://cnn.com/2013/09/01/tech/tech-competition/index.html. The Daily Tech Digest, a weekly publication in the U.S. and monthly in the UK, offers an offbeat look at major tech stories and explores the future of artificial intelligence; it is free to read with premium content available for a fee, and updates are provided bi-weekly until the year's end via their website and social media (@dailytechdigest on Twitter, www.facebook.com/dailytech Digest on Facebook), including a weekly Newsquiz. Forem, a free and open-source software platform, is available for download as an app or service from the Google Play store (forem.org, Future.dev.to, DEV.community). Support resources are available via the Samaritans (08457 90 90 90, www.samaritans.org) and the National Suicide Prevention Line in the U.S. (1-800-273-8255, www.suicideprevention.org).

all_summary.summary: September 2025 has been nothing short of transformative in the technology sector. The pace of transformation is accelerating as governments scramble to regulate emerging trends. From music streaming to biomethane-powered buses, from esports debates to health updates, we look at the top tech stories of the month. We'll explore each major headline with care, unpacking its implications and looking beyond the surface. See the full list of the top news stories in tech for September 2025 at: http://www.styletech.net/top-tech-news-top-stories-september-2525. For more tech news, visit our News Tech page. For the latest from CNN Tech, visit http://cnn.com/2013/09/01/tech/tech-competition/index.html.

The Daily Tech Digest is a weekly, offbeat look at the biggest stories in tech. This week, we look at some of the biggest news stories of the week. Plus, we take a look at what's coming next in the field of artificial intelligence. The Daily Tech digest is published once a week in the U.S. and once a month in the UK. It's free to read, but you'll have to pay for the privilege. We hope to see you in the next edition of the Digest, which will be published every other week until the end of the year. For more information, visit our website or follow us on Twitter @dailytechdigest or on Facebook at www.facebook.com/dailytech Digest. We'll also be posting a weekly Newsquiz to test your knowledge of stories.

Forem can be downloaded as an app or a service from the Google Play store. For more information, visit forem.org or go to the Future.dev website. For help with software, visit the Dev. community. For support, call the Samaritans on 08457 90 90 90 or visit a local Samaritans branch, see www.samaritans.org for details. In the U.S. call the National Suicide Prevention Line on 1-800-273-8255 or visit www.suicideprevention.org.

World.final_summary: The global backlash against Israel over the humanitarian toll of the war in Gaza has spread into sports and culture, with protests disrupting a cycling race in Spain, fans booing the Israeli national anthem at a basketball game in Poland, and threats of boycotts against Israel's participation in a signature European entertainment event. Critics argue Israel should be sidelined from international events, similar to Russia's situation following its invasion of Ukraine, while the IOC claims Israel hasn't breached the Olympic charter like Russia. Despite calls from the UN Security Council for an end to the Israeli occupation of Gaza, and joint statements from the UK, Canada, Australia and 25 other countries demanding an immediate end to the war, Israel has not been shut out by global sports institutions like the International Olympic Committee or FIFA.

all_summary.summary: The global backlash against Israel over the humanitarian toll of the war in Gaza has spread into the arenas of sports and culture. A major cycling race in Spain was disrupted by protests against an Israeli team. A basketball game in Poland was preceded by fans booing the Israeli national anthem. Several European countries are threatening to boycott a signature entertainment event if Israel takes part. Israel’s critics say it should be sidelined from international events just like Russia has been since its full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022. The IOC has said Israel hasn’t breached the Olympic charter like Russia, when it annexed territories in eastern Ukraine. Israel has not been shut out by global sports institutions like the International Olympic Committee or world soccer body FIFA. The UN Security Council has called for an end to the Israeli occupation of Gaza.

Entertainment.final_summary: This week's episode of NPR's Morning Edition will feature music from Beyonce and Kanye West. The show, produced by the team behind the award-winning "This is Life with Barack Obama," airs weekdays at 9 a.m. ET on CBS. "This is Life With Barack Obama" is available on CNN.com. More information, including a full list of featured shows and details about the show and its producers, can be found on NPR's official website. The full show is also available on the website.

all_summary.summary: This week's episode of NPR's Morning Edition features music from the likes of Beyonce and Kanye West. The show is produced by the same team that produced the award-winning "This is Life with Barack Obama" The show airs weekdays at 9 a.m. ET on CBS. For more information on the show, go to: http://www.npr.org/s/morning-edition/nx-s1-5528996. For a full list of the show's featured shows, visit: http:www. NPR.org/. For more about the show and its producers, visit the show’s official website. For the full show, visit http: www.nPR.org. This is Life With Barack Obama is on CNN.com.

Local News.final_summary: Students across schools will present the latest news in their morning assembly to stay updated on important happenings. Key headlines include the commencement of BSEB STET 2025 registrations at bsebstet.org, a report indicating that India's millionaire households have nearly doubled in four years, and a lawsuit against Boeing and Honeywell by Air India crash victim families. Noida International Airport is set to be inaugurated on October 30. In sports, P V Sindhu has reached the quarterfinals of the China Masters, and Japan is considering North Korea's participation in the 2026 Asian Games. Also highlighted are the top 10 universities in India based on academics, sports, and culture.

all_summary.summary: Students across schools will present the latest news in their morning assembly. This practice keeps them updated about important happenings in India and the world. Here are 19 key headlines for today covering national, international, and sports news. BSEB STET 2025: Registration begins at bsebstet.org; direct link here. India's millionaire households nearly double in four years: Hurun India Wealth Report. Boeing, Honeywell sued by Air India crash victim families. Noida International Airport to be inaugurated on Oct 30. P V Sindhu sails into the quarterfinals of the China Masters. Japan considering North Korea's participation in 2026 Asian Games. Top 10 universities in India with the highest marks in terms of academics, sports and culture.

Sports.final_summary: Eli Manning has offered his support to rookie NY Giants quarterback Jaxson Dart, encouraging him to reach out anytime. The Chicago Bears, Dallas Cowboys, and Cowboys are considered top-rated teams in the NFL this season; however, opinions on their Super Bowl chances are mixed, with some sources indicating the Bears and Cowboys have the best odds, while others suggest the Cowboys and Bears have the worst odds. The Atlanta Falcons are projected to potentially finish in the top 10 of the NFL’s top 100, while the Philadelphia Eagles are seen as having the lowest chance of avoiding the bottom 10. The Cleveland Cavaliers are recognized as the best-rated team in NFL history, and the New England Patriots remain the most-loved team in football. Conversely, the Washington Redskins are the least-liked team in sports, and the Los Angeles Chargers are the highest-scoring team in football. A daily discussion pondered questions such as personal well-being, safety, and preferences.

all_summary.summary: Eli Manning told rookie NY Giants quarterback Jaxson Dart that he can call him any time. Today In Sports: Friday, September 19, 2025. Today in Sports: September 18, 20251 min read-only. Today's Daily Discussion: September 17, 20, 2025. Today’s Daily Discussion includes: ‘What do you think?’ ‘I don’t know.’. ‘How do you feel about it?' ‘Are you sure you’re OK with it?” ‘Is it safe for you to go out and have a drink with your friends?‘ ‘Do you like it when I say ‘yes’ or ‘no’?  ‘Can you do something about it? Does it make you feel better or makes you feel worse?‬’

The Bears, Cowboys and Cowboys are among the top-rated teams in the NFL this season. The Bears and Cowboys have the best odds of winning the Super Bowl. The Dallas Cowboys are the worst-ranked team in the league. The Chicago Bears have the worst odds of any team. The Atlanta Falcons have the highest odds of finishing in the top 10 of the NFL’s top 100. The Philadelphia Eagles have the lowest odds of ending the season in the bottom 10. The Cleveland Cavaliers are the best-rated team in NFL history. The New England Patriots are the most-loved team in all of football. The Washington Redskins are the least-liked team in sports. The Los Angeles Chargers are the highest-scoring team in football.
